indolent pose in which Rostov had left him, rubbing his small white hands. 
"Well there certainly are disgusting people," thought Rost6v as he entered. 
"Have you told them to bring the horse?" asked Telydnin, getting up and looking care- lessly about him. 
"I have." 
"Let us go ourselves. I only came round to ask Denisov about yesterday's order. Have you got it, Denisov?" 
"Not yet. But where are you off to?" 
"I want to teach this young man how to shoe a horse," said Telydnin.
